clinical_study.brief_title: Profile Fecal Analysis of Neutropenic Enterocolitis
clinical_study.official_title: Neutropenic Enterocolitis in Critically Ill Hematological Patients: Taxonomic and Functional Analysis of Gut Microbiota

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, single-center, cohort study to allow collecting observations of patients receiving induction chemotherapy for primary Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML), collecting biological samples(including fecal samples for microbiota analyses, and metagenomic profiling in blood samples) and clinical outcomes (notably the occurrence of neutropenic enterocolitis), with a nested case-control analysis comparing patients with or without neutropenic enterocolitis

primary_outcome.description: Shannon index of α-diversity assessed by shotgun metagenomic analysis of the stool

secondary_outcome.description: Death while hospitalized in the intensive care unit

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of any local neutropenic enterocolitis complications
secondary_outcome.description: Local neutropenic enterocolitis complications defined as perforation or digestive hemorrhage or abscess

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of microbiologically documented infections in patients with severe neutropenic enterocolitis
secondary_outcome.description: Microbiologically documented infections defined as pneumonia, invasive device infections, urinary tract infections, digestive or neuro-meningitis infections

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of malnutrition in patients with severe neutropenic enterocolitis
secondary_outcome.description: Malnutrition defined by the European Society of Clinical nutrition and Metabolism
Analysis of alpha and beta-diversity in fecal samples from day 0 to day 60
Identification of clusters of gene expression

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients receiving induction chemotherapy for primary Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML)
